channel.title: Vanilla Townies - Are they still despised?
channel.description:
The good news is: I've nearly designed a new large 28-player game! I'm polishing it up but I have some cool ideas that I'm trying to balance and they're not all entirely unfun.
The bad news is: I've gone through the mechanics I have repeatedly and can only conclude that the game will only work the way I have it currently set up if **there are vanilla townies**, roles with absolutely no special abiltiies.
As such, here's a poll:
[poll type=regular results=always public=true] * I won't play a game where I can rand VT. * I might play a game where i can rand VT. * I want to play a game where i can rand VT. [/poll]
You can also use this thread to rant about how you hate/love rolemadness games, although to stop the poll being biased I won't post anything in here except for answering questions. Let''s see how long I stick to that rule, eh?

item.title: Vanilla Townies - Are they still despised?

item.description:
My reads have been improving with every game so its becoming less of an issue, but still only reads VT games can be fun, but if I had to pick I’d pick a PR heavy game or a VT heavy game, Id prob pick PR

item.source: Vanilla Townies - Are they still despised?

item.title: Vanilla Townies - Are they still despised?
item.dc:creator: DatBird
item.description:
Hey just gonna throw my opinion in. Vanilla townies are fine, they are a change of pace, because usually everyone has an abilitiies and no abilities are fun sometimes. Now the problem I have with them is when one of two things happen. There is nothing to supplement the VT experience like ITAs, Mechanics, or Events. So its only voting and talking. At this point you are only there to make reads and vote. This can get really dull in some case and really dampen the mood of the game imo. Like Im not the best read maker so when its all I can do, I kinda like I feel even more pointless. The other problem is when one side feels heavily out weighed in abilities compared to another. So like if its only VTs against a stacked team of wolves with like 2 or so abilities each. Like VT townies can be fine but mechanics need to be there for fun and it needs to be that the wolf team isnt stacked compared to them.

Read full topic
